stories.text:
When writing macros the main idea is to convert the tree that represents the code into a modified tree.

What is the best way to describe such alterations in non ad-hoc, more declarative manner?

The only thing that comes to my mind is something with a functionality of XSLT.

Do you know of some more light weight libraries in any language with similar capabilities as XSLT when it comes to transforming trees into other trees?
stories.title: Ask HN: Easiest way to code AST transformations

stories.text:
I have been working as a freelance developer for a few years now. All my customers come through a middle-man, typically a consultancy agency.

I believe I am good at what I do but I dont have any strong brand per say.

What would you do to attract better clients and get a higher rate?

Any thoughts on things like starting a blog, being a conference speaker, or working on an open-source projects?
stories.title: Ask HN: Advice on building a brand as a freelance developer?
